metadata.name: Differences in Sameness
metadata.description:
Since 1975, Washington, DC based artist Carol  
Brown Goldberg has been an active painter and  
sculptor, with over a hundred solo and group  
shows in the United States and abroad.  
Studying at the Corcoran School of Art under  
Gene Davis, she was awarded the Eugene M.  
Weisz award upon graduation. In 1989 and  
1990, Goldberg produced and curated a 14-  
part lecture series, “Voices of Our Time,” which  
explored the relationship between art and  
science—a long held interest for the artist. She  
has shown in the U.S. and internationally in over  
100 solo and group exhibitions, including solo  
traveling painting exhibits throughout Spain  
and Mexico. Her work is included in many  
museums and private collections..
